channel.title: ::command
channel.description: How do i get the ::command thing to work and how do i edit it to show all the commands up for normal ppl, mods and then admins?? Cheers Leylo ;) :D :)

item.title: ::command
item.dc:creator: @leylo leylo
item.description:
@leylo wrote:

I meant for when i log in and people put ::command
That it shows the scroll up saying all the list of commands that i can do…

Read full topic

item.title: ::command
item.dc:creator: @ajcordio ajcordio
item.description:
@ajcordio wrote:

Follow theese steps below:

Server file>>Client.Java>>Ctrl+f>>Command.Startswith>>

Then after that you edit the Commands it should say this:

if (command.startsWith(“Example”) && playerRights >= 2)

Dont worry about the line though.
Whats the player rights? You ask?
If you go to characters and pull up your account it should look like this:

[ACCOUNT]
character-username = Example
character-password = Example1

[CHARACTER]
character-height = 0
character-posx = 2804
character-posy = 3183
character-rights = This is the character rights) Key: 0-Normal>>1-Moderator>>2-Administrator>>3±Owner>>
character-ismember = 1
character-messages = 0
character-lastconnection = localhost
character-lastlogin = 20070420

[FRIENDS]

[IGNORES]

[EOF]

Then Change The rep on the command to what yours is(OR ANY OTHER NUMBER).
AddItems To your command>> First You type in this:

addItem(Item id goes here, Item amount goes here);

Like that you can do as many as you want.
(But it has to be 28 items or lower)
Then Compile your files(Option c)
Then close your current running server and open it agian.
If your account is Reconnecting let it reconnect.
but if your account logged out then re-log back in.
Then type the command that you had as(Example:

::Example

Then it gives the items that you added to The command.
(Hope This helps you!
